args.query: Let D(n) be the set of all diagonal matrices in GL(n). Show that D(n) is a matrix group.

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

/-- Let D(n) be the set of diagonal invertible n√ón matrices over a field ùïú (viewed as units).
    This theorem asserts that there exists a subgroup of the units of `Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ùïú`
    whose carrier is exactly the set of invertible diagonal matrices. -/
theorem diagonal_matrices_form_subgroup (ùïú : Type _) [Field ùïú] (n : ‚Ñï) :
  ‚àÉ (H : Subgroup ((Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ùïú)À£)),
    H.carrier = { u | ‚àÄ i j, i ‚â† j ‚Üí (u : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ùïú) i j = 0 } := by
